qas.question: What association founded the Avery Normal Institute?
What type of school was the Avery Normal Institute?
Who attended the Avery Normal Institute?
What general supported the conversion of a US Arsenal into Porter Military Academy?
Soldiers and boys helped by Porter Military Academy were affected by what?
What association never founded the Avery Normal Institute?
What type of school wasn't the Avery Normal Institute?
Who never attended the Avery Normal Institute?
What general supported the conversion of a UN Arsenal into Porter Military Academy?
oldiers and boys helped by Porter Military Academy weren't affected by what?

context: Industries slowly brought the city and its inhabitants back to a renewed vitality and jobs attracted new residents. As the city's commerce improved, residents worked to restore or create community institutions. In 1865, the Avery Normal Institute was established by <a0_0>the <b5_0>American Missionary Association<b5_0/><a0_0/> as the first <a1_0><b6_0>free secondary school<b6_0/><a1_0/> for <a2_0><b7_0>Charleston's African American population<b7_0/><a2_0/>. General <a3_0><b8_0>William T. Sherman<b8_0/><a3_0/> lent his support to the conversion of the United States Arsenal into the Porter Military Academy, an educational facility for former soldiers and boys left orphaned or destitute by the <a4_0><b9_0>war<b9_0/><a4_0/>. Porter Military Academy later joined with Gaud School and is now a university-preparatory school, Porter-Gaud School.
